channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Pluggable Style Representation Learning for Multi-Style Transfer
item.description: Specifically, for style modeling, we propose a style representation learning scheme to encode the style information into a compact representation.

item.title: Contextual Checkerboard Denoise -- A Novel Neural Network-Based Approach for Classification-Aware OCT Image Denoising
item.description: In contrast to non-medical image denoising, where enhancing image clarity is the primary goal, medical image denoising warrants preservation of crucial features without introduction of new artifacts.

item.title: Handling irresolvable conflicts in the Semantic Web: an RDF-based conflict-tolerant version of the Deontic Traditional Scheme
item.description: This paper presents a new ontology that implements the well-known Deontic Traditional Scheme in RDFs and SPARQL, fit to handle irresolvable conflicts, i. e., situations in which two or more statements prescribe conflicting obligations, prohibitions, or permissions, with none of them being "stronger" than the other one(s).

item.title: AIDetx: a compression-based method for identification of machine-learning generated text
item.description: This paper introduces AIDetx, a novel method for detecting machine-generated text using data compression techniques.

item.title: Feedback-driven object detection and iterative model improvement
item.description: In this paper, we present the development and evaluation of a platform designed to interactively improve object detection models.

item.title: LDA-AQU: Adaptive Query-guided Upsampling via Local Deformable Attention
item.description: Therefore, we introduce local self-attention into the upsampling task and demonstrate that the majority of existing upsamplers can be regarded as special cases of upsamplers based on local self-attention.

item.title: GuardSplat: Robust and Efficient Watermarking for 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Specifically, 1) We first propose a CLIP-guided Message Decoupling Optimization module for training the message decoder, leveraging CLIP's aligning capability and rich representations to achieve a high extraction accuracy with minimal optimization costs, presenting exceptional capability and efficiency.

item.title: Deepfake Media Generation and Detection in the Generative AI Era: A Survey and Outlook
item.description: With the recent advancements in generative modeling, the realism of deepfake content has been increasing at a steady pace, even reaching the point where people often fail to detect manipulated media content online, thus being deceived into various kinds of scams.

item.title: Auto-RAG: Autonomous Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Large Language Models
item.description: Iterative retrieval refers to the process in which the model continuously queries the retriever during generation to enhance the relevance of the retrieved knowledge, thereby improving the performance of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

item.title: Uniform Attention Maps: Boosting Image Fidelity in Reconstruction and Editing
item.description: This study underscores the potential of uniform attention maps to enhance the fidelity and versatility of diffusion-based image processing methods.

item.title: Accelerating Multimodal Large Language Models via Dynamic Visual-Token Exit and the Empirical Findings
item.description: In particular, we reveal that visual tokens will stop contributing to reasoning when the text tokens receive enough image information, yielding obvious visual redundancy.

item.title: Enhanced anomaly detection in well log data through the application of ensemble GANs
item.description: This study extends the ensemble GANs (EGANs) framework to capture the distribution of well log data and detect anomalies that fall outside of these distributions.

item.title: SURE-VQA: Systematic Understanding of Robustness Evaluation in Medical VQA Tasks
item.description: Vision-Language Models (VLMs) have great potential in medical tasks, like Visual Question Answering (VQA), where they could act as interactive assistants for both patients and clinicians.

item.title: MCUCoder: Adaptive Bitrate Learned Video Compression for IoT Devices
item.description: The rapid growth of camera-based IoT devices demands the need for efficient video compression, particularly for edge applications where devices face hardware constraints, often with only 1 or 2 MB of RAM and unstable internet connections.

item.title: A Multi-Loss Strategy for Vehicle Trajectory Prediction: Combining Off-Road, Diversity, and Directional Consistency Losses
item.description: Trajectory prediction is essential for the safety and efficiency of planning in autonomous vehicles.

item.title: DELT: A Simple Diversity-driven EarlyLate Training for Dataset Distillation
item.description: The conventional batch-to-batch matching mechanism is ideal for small-scale datasets and includes bi-level optimization methods on models and syntheses, such as FRePo, RCIG, and RaT-BPTT, as well as other methods like distribution matching, gradient matching, and weight trajectory matching.

item.title: Cross-Domain Recommendation Meets Large Language Models
item.description: Cross-domain recommendation (CDR) has emerged as a promising solution to the cold-start problem, faced by single-domain recommender systems.

item.title: DeMo: Decoupled Momentum Optimization
item.description: Training large neural networks typically requires sharing gradients between accelerators through specialized high-speed interconnects.

item.title: Ensemble Watermarks for Large Language Models
item.description: Concretely, we combine acrostica and sensorimotor norms with the established red-green watermark to achieve a 98% detection rate.

item.title: Initialization using Update Approximation is a Silver Bullet for Extremely Efficient Low-Rank Fine-Tuning
item.description: Low-rank adapters have become a standard approach for efficiently fine-tuning large language models (LLMs), but they often fall short of achieving the performance of full fine-tuning.

item.title: ChineseWebText 2.0: Large-Scale High-quality Chinese Web Text with Multi-dimensional and fine-grained information
item.description: With this approach, we release the largest, high-quality and fine-grained Chinese text ChineseWebText2. 0, which consists of 3. 8TB and each text is associated with a quality score, domain labels, a toxicity label and a toxicity score, facilitating the LLM researchers to select data based on various types of fine-grained information.

item.title: Dual Risk Minimization: Towards Next-Level Robustness in Fine-tuning Zero-Shot Models
item.description: Fine-tuning foundation models often compromises their robustness to distribution shifts.

item.title: T2Vid: Translating Long Text into Multi-Image is the Catalyst for Video-LLMs
item.description: In this work, our study of these approaches harvests an effective data augmentation method.

item.title: Federated Continual Graph Learning
item.description: To address these challenges, we present a pioneering study on Federated Continual Graph Learning (FCGL), which adapts GNNs to multiple evolving graphs within decentralized settings while adhering to storage and privacy constraints.

item.title: SADG: Segment Any Dynamic Gaussian Without Object Trackers
item.description: We introduce SADG, Segment Any Dynamic Gaussian Without Object Trackers, a novel approach that combines dynamic Gaussian Splatting representation and semantic information without reliance on object IDs.

item.title: Enhancing Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning of Vision Transformers through Frequency-Based Adaptation
item.description: Adapting vision transformer foundation models through parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) methods has become increasingly popular.

item.title: COMPrompter: reconceptualized segment anything model with multiprompt network for camouflaged object detection
item.description: To achieve this, we propose an edge gradient extraction module, which generates a mask containing gradient information regarding the boundaries of camouflaged objects.

item.title: Scale Invariance of Graph Neural Networks
item.description: We address two fundamental challenges in Graph Neural Networks (GNNs): (1) the lack of theoretical support for invariance learning, a critical property in image processing, and (2) the absence of a unified model capable of excelling on both homophilic and heterophilic graph datasets.

item.title: ANDHRA Bandersnatch: Training Neural Networks to Predict Parallel Realities
item.description: Inspired by the Many-Worlds Interpretation (MWI), this work introduces a novel neural network architecture that splits the same input signal into parallel branches at each layer, utilizing a Hyper Rectified Activation, referred to as ANDHRA.

item.title: GEOBench-VLM: Benchmarking Vision-Language Models for Geospatial Tasks
item.description: To address this gap in the geospatial domain, we present GEOBench-VLM, a comprehensive benchmark specifically designed to evaluate VLMs on geospatial tasks, including scene understanding, object counting, localization, fine-grained categorization, and temporal analysis.

item.title: Parameter-Efficient Transfer Learning for Music Foundation Models
item.description: Common ways of adapting music foundation models to downstream tasks are probing and fine-tuning.

item.title: Revealing Key Details to See Differences: A Novel Prototypical Perspective for Skeleton-based Action Recognition
item.description: In skeleton-based action recognition, a key challenge is distinguishing between actions with similar trajectories of joints due to the lack of image-level details in skeletal representations.

item.title: Detailed Object Description with Controllable Dimensions
item.description: Therefore, it can not only improve the quality of object details but also offer flexibility in including or excluding specific dimensions based on user preferences.

item.title: I Dream My Painting: Connecting MLLMs and Diffusion Models via Prompt Generation for Text-Guided Multi-Mask Inpainting
item.description: Inpainting focuses on filling missing or corrupted regions of an image to blend seamlessly with its surrounding content and style.

item.title: OMNI-DC: Highly Robust Depth Completion with Multiresolution Depth Integration
item.description: To evaluate our model, we establish a new evaluation protocol named Robust-DC for zero-shot testing under various sparse depth patterns.

item.title: Det-SAM2:Technical Report on the Self-Prompting Segmentation Framework Based on Segment Anything Model 2
item.description: Segment Anything Model 2 (SAM2) demonstrates exceptional performance in video segmentation and refinement of segmentation results.

item.title: HUPE: Heuristic Underwater Perceptual Enhancement with Semantic Collaborative Learning
item.description: To strike a balance between visual quality and application, we propose a heuristic invertible network for underwater perception enhancement, dubbed HUPE, which enhances visual quality and demonstrates flexibility in handling other downstream tasks.

item.title: Convolutional Neural Networks Do Work with Pre-Defined Filters
item.description: We present a novel class of Convolutional Neural Networks called Pre-defined Filter Convolutional Neural Networks (PFCNNs), where all nxn convolution kernels with n>1 are pre-defined and constant during training.

item.title: Helvipad: A Real-World Dataset for Omnidirectional Stereo Depth Estimation
item.description: Despite considerable progress in stereo depth estimation, omnidirectional imaging remains underexplored, mainly due to the lack of appropriate data.

item.title: RL for Mitigating Cascading Failures: Targeted Exploration via Sensitivity Factors
item.description: Electricity grid's resiliency and climate change strongly impact one another due to an array of technical and policy-related decisions that impact both.

item.title: Neural Surface Priors for Editable Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Unlike other methods, our pipeline allows modifications applied to the extracted mesh to be propagated to the proxy representation, from which we recover the updated parameters of the Gaussians.

item.title: VideoLLM Knows When to Speak: Enhancing Time-Sensitive Video Comprehension with Video-Text Duet Interaction Format
item.description: We construct MMDuetIT, a video-text training dataset designed to adapt VideoLLMs to video-text duet interaction format.

item.title: Emergence of Self-Identity in AI: A Mathematical Framework and Empirical Study with Generative Large Language Models
item.description: This paper introduces a mathematical framework for defining and quantifying self-identity in artificial intelligence (AI) systems, addressing a critical gap in the theoretical foundations of artificial consciousness.

item.title: Monocular Obstacle Avoidance Based on Inverse PPO for Fixed-wing UAVs
item.description: After that, a reinforcement learning controller with a novel reward function is designed to balance the target approach and flight trajectory smoothness, satisfying the specific dynamic constraints and stability requirements of a fixed-wing UAV platform.

item.title: Learning optimal objective values for MILP
item.description: Modern Mixed Integer Linear Programming (MILP) solvers use the Branch-and-Bound algorithm together with a plethora of auxiliary components that speed up the search.

item.title: Optimizing Multispectral Object Detection: A Bag of Tricks and Comprehensive Benchmarks
item.description: Multispectral object detection, utilizing RGB and TIR (thermal infrared) modalities, is widely recognized as a challenging task.

item.title: Transfer Learning for Deep Learning-based Prediction of Lattice Thermal Conductivity
item.description: Interestingly, we also show that a much greater improvement is obtained when first fine-tuning it on a large datasets of low-quality approximations of LTC (based on the AGL model) and then applying a second phase of fine-tuning with our high-quality, smaller-scale datasets.

item.title: QuaLLM-Health: An Adaptation of an LLM-Based Framework for Quantitative Data Extraction from Online Health Discussions
item.description: In this work, we present an adapted framework from QuaLLM into QuaLLM-Health for extracting clinically relevant quantitative data from Reddit discussions about glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) receptor agonists using large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Deep Fourier-embedded Network for Bi-modal Salient Object Detection
item.description: The rapid development of deep learning provides a significant improvement of salient object detection combining both RGB and thermal images.

item.title: Aligning Knowledge Concepts to Whole Slide Images for Precise Histopathology Image Analysis
item.description: Due to the large size and lack of fine-grained annotation, Whole Slide Images (WSIs) analysis is commonly approached as a Multiple Instance Learning (MIL) problem.
